business.headline: Nayara Energy seeks ships from India to ferry refined fuels: ReportSanctions-hit Nayara is struggling to get vessels for the supply of refined fuels for its retail stations in India. The private refiner has already cut crude runs at its refinery.

Adani to build India's biggest privately funded coal power plant in a decadeThe first of three units at the plant will be commissioned within four years, with the last expected to come online in five years' time, Adani Power said.

TCS hikes salaries for 80% staff amid layoffs: ReportIn a message sent to employees, the company confirmed that the salary increase will apply to around 80% of the workforce and will take effect from September 1, 2025.

How Trump's 100% chip tariff plan has shaken the global semiconductor industrySpeaking from the Oval Office, Trump said the move is aimed at boosting local manufacturing and reducing reliance on foreign-made chips. He added that companies like Apple, which recently committed an extra $100 billion investment in the US, would not be charged the new tariffs.

Trump hits India with 50% tariffs: What's at stake and what next?A sweeping 50% tariff could significantly impact India's export economy, threatening jobs and trade ties. As Donald Trump ramps up pressure, all eyes are now on New Delhi's next move.

From seafood to auto: How will Trump's 50% tariff impact different sectorsThe tariff hike, set to take effect from August 27, follows a warning issued by Trump earlier over India's continued oil imports from Russia.

Skipped your ITR for years? Here's how it can impact you legally and financiallyIt might feel harmless to skip filing your Income Tax Return once or twice, but if you've been ignoring it for years, you could be heading for serious trouble. From steep penalties to even jail time, here's what you need to know before it's too late.

JSW Cement IPO opens for subscription. Should you apply or skip?Brokerages are mostly positive about JSW Cement IPO, though some advise caution due to the stretched valuation and inconsistent profitability.

Sensex tanks 500 points on 50% Trump's tariff blow: Should Investors worry?The Sensex slipped over 250 points at the open before paring some losses. The Nifty50 was also trading lower, reflecting broad-based caution and expectations of a volatile trading session.

Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump announces additional tariffs; experts advise cautionWhile Sensex opened 250 points lower, it was trading just 131.05 points lower at 80,412.94 at 9:22 am, indicating that the session could see wild swings and high volatility. Nifty50 was also down 67.25 points to 24,506.95.

How India can turn Trump's tariffs into a strategic advantageThe new tariff of an additional 25%, announced on Wednesday, will come into effect 21 days from August 7. This sharp increase in duties comes at a time when trade talks between the two countries have reached a dead end.

PM's Economic Advisory Council members on Trump's tariff war, India's growth strategyPrime Minister Narendra Modi's Economic Advisory Council members, Dr Sajjid Chinoy and Neelkanth Mishra, share their perspectives on the additional 25 per cent tariffs imposed by Donald Trump on Indian imports to the US over buying Russian oil and India's growth strategy.

entertainment.headline: Lokesh Kanagaraj visits Tiruvannamalai temple before Coolie release, snaps at paps'Coolie' director Lokesh Kanagaraj visited Tiruvannamalai temple ahead of the film's release. In one of the viral videos, the filmmaker was seen getting angry at the photographers.

Coolie advance booking: Kerala shows to begin at 6 am, Tamil Nadu shows at 9 amRajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Karthik Subbaraj, is all set to release in theatres on August 14. The advance booking has begun in selected theatres with early shows in Kerala at 6 am and 5 am shows in the United Kingdom.

Netflix announces new film Inspector Zende with Manoj Bajpayee, Jim Sarbh'Inspector Zende', a crime drama inspired by true events, will premiere in September. Starring Manoj Bajpayee and Jim Sarbh, the film celebrates the gritty, instinct-driven detective work of a determined police officer chasing the notorious 'Swimsuit Killer'.
Angelina Jolie may reveal Brad Pitt secrets in memoir amid legal battle: ReportActor Angelina Jolie has reportedly warned that she's ready to reveal explosive details about her ex-husband Brad Pitt.

Ankita Lokhande's house help's daughter found safe after FIR, actor thanks policeAnkita Lokhande shared that two missing girls, including her house help's daughter, have been found safe after she filed a complaint and sought public help. She thanked the Mumbai Police and Mumbaikars for their swift support and prayers.

Kingdom to release in Sri Lanka amid protests over Tamil representationVijay Deverakonda's action drama 'Kingdom' is set to release in Sri Lanka on August 8. This comes amid protests against the film over the misrepresentation of Sri Lankan Tamils.

Ahaan and Aneet on Saiyaara success: Grateful, but nervous about what lies aheadActors Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda thanked fans and shared their apprehensions after the massive success of 'Saiyaara'. In an emotional note, the actors said they fear what's next and if they'd be enough.

Exclusive: John Abraham says he's been after Anurag Kashyap for No Smoking sequelJohn Abraham expressed interest in making a sequel to the cult classic 'No Smoking'. He also praised Anurag Kashyap's disturbing new film 'Bandar', highlighting his love for unique storytelling.

Case against Malayalam actor Shweta Menon for allegedly acting in vulgar filmsErnakulam Central Police have registered a case against Malayalam actor Shweta Menon for alleged obscene and vulgar content in films and ads. The case comes as she is contesting for the AMMA president post.

Janaabe Aali teaser: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's song is an epic war on dance floorHrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's latest song 'Janaabe Aali' teaser from 'War 2' is out. The video gives a stunning glimpse of the dance face-off between the two actors.

Mayasabha review: Friendship, betrayal and power in this gutsy political dramaRelease Date:Thu Aug 07, 2025'Mayasabha: The Rise of the Titans' Review: The Telugu political thriller, streaming on SonyLIV, offers a bold, intense narrative with strong performances, making it a compelling watch for fans of high-stakes drama with a regional flavour.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi Ep 9: Mihir rejects misogyny in powerful episodeWhen a marriage proposal to Pari turns into a test of her freedom, it's Mihir who delivers the final word. A progressive episode of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot puts gender roles, kitchen politics, and regressive in-laws in their place.

Malaika Arora hosts lunch for Salman Khan's sisters Alvira, Arpita. VideoMalaika Arora hosted a special lunch for Salman Khan's sisters, Alvira and Arpita, and their children at her new restaurant in Mumbai. Even after her divorce from Arbaaz Khan, she shares a close and friendly bond with the Khan family.

Ranveer Singh touches elderly fan's feet, kisses her hand, video goes viralRanveer Singh won hearts with a sweet gesture as he touched an elderly fan's feet and kissed her hand outside a Mumbai studio. The video was widely shared on multiple platforms.

Vaani Kapoor backs Diljit Dosanjh amid Sardaar Ji 3 release row: He's a global starVaani Kapoor has defended Diljit Dosanjh's decision to release 'Sardaar Ji 3' overseas amid calls for a ban, stating the film was shot before the Pahalgam terror attack and no laws were broken. Despite criticism, the film became the highest-grossing Punjabi movie of the year with an international-only release.

Weapons review: Zach Cregger's horror gets weird, wild and wickedly smartRelease Date:Fri Aug 08, 2025'Weapons' review: Zach Cregger's latest film 'Weapons' is a bold and unsettling horror mystery that combines dread, gore and dark humour. Set to release on August 8, 2025, the film explores themes of trauma and paranoia through a gripping and unpredictable narrative.

Hrithik Roshan sends Naatu Naatu billboard to Jr NTR in playful War 2 face-offThe playful banter between Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR through themed billboard trucks has sparked excitement ahead of their much-awaited film 'War 2'. On Thursday, Roshan sent NTR a 'Naatu Naatu' billboard.

The Pickup review: Poor American version of Dhoom 3 with Eddie Murphy's brillianceRelease Date:Wed Aug 06, 2025The Pickup review: 'The Pickup' has actor Eddie Murphy in the lead role. Despite a talented cast, the movie lacks emotional depth and soulful narrative.

Ed Sheeran calls out lip-syncing in music industry, says can't get away with itEd Sheeran addressed the common yet seldom admitted practice of lip-syncing in the music industry. During an interview, he emphasised his commitment to genuine live performances.

general news.headline: PM Modi's stern message to Trump: We will pay any price to protect our farmersPrime Minister Narendra Modi's remarks were seen as a direct response to US President Donald Trump, who slapped a 50 per cent tariff on India for its continued purchases of Russian oil. Read the full story below and join the conversation: Should India hold its ground as the US ratchets up its tariff war?

How a saree hidden in Prajwal Revanna's farmhouse sealed his fate in rape caseA hidden saree helped convict former MP Prajwal Revanna for raping a 47-year-old domestic worker. The forensic evidence on it proved crucial to the case. He was sentenced to life imprisonment and fined Rs 11 lakh.

Tit for tat: Shashi Tharoor wants India to match Trump's 50% tariff hikeCongress MP Shashi Tharoor criticises US tariff hike on Indian exports citing unfair targeting. He urges Modi government to impose reciprocal duties and explore alternative trade markets.

Supreme Court rejects Justice Varma's plea in cash row, clears decks for removalJustice Yashwant Varma had challenged the in-house inquiry report that recommended his removal after a large cash stash was found in his residence earlier this year.

Will Trump's tariff bombs see India, Russia, China gang-up on US?Trump India tariffs: August is already seeing hectic diplomatic activity as Trump drops tariff bombs on India. NSA Ajit Doval is in Russia, and Jaishankar will head there in a few days. Meanwhile, PM Modi will visit China later this month.

3 CRPF jawans killed, many injured as bus with 23 plunges into gorge in J&KThree CRPF personnel died and 16 were injured after a bunker vehicle overturned in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur. The vehicle was carrying 23 jawans. Rescue efforts were launched immediately.

How tired is Mohammed Siraj?Mohammed Siraj's tireless bowling across formats has made him India's most dependable pacer, but his staggering workload raises red flags about long-term sustainability. Is India over-relying on Siraj at the cost of his fitness?

Pigeon vs balcony: Urban India's most relatable crisisBalconies are sacred. And this is something pigeons are not in agreement with. It is a shared space. These gutar-goo drones ensure that the space is bombed by their faecal projectiles, so that you never dare to put anything of value in the balcony. That fake grass carpet? Pigeons love it.

Open office, closed minds? Why babus feel exposed in Kartavya BhavanPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Kartavya Bhavan-3, which will house several ministries of the Central government. However, top Central government officers have written to the PMO over the lack of private cabins in the building. They say the open-seating arrangement compromises confidentiality, affects efficiency and is demoralising.

China-Pak military integration: What is CENTAIC and should India be concerned?CENTAIC, a China-backed AI and computing centre in Pakistan, aims to transform the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) into a network-centric force integrated with China's military systems. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi mentioned CENTAIC in his Op Sindoor speech. Here's more about CENTAIC and if it should be a concern for India.

'Always on' lifestyle is damaging our hearts: Dr Shriram NeneThere's a growing heart disease crisis in India and inactive habits and digital overload are mostly to blame. Renowned cardiac surgeon Dr Shriram Nene warns how young professionals are especially vulnerable to the dangers of the "always on" culture.

Trump targeting India for not letting him take ceasefire credit? What analyst saidThe White House announcement marks an escalation in tensions, especially as India has remained firm on continuing energy imports from Moscow despite US pressure. The Trump administration has increasingly tied economic penalties to foreign policy grievances -- and India appears to be next in line.

Chandrayaan-2 finds Athena's crash site, sends never-before-seen picsThe Athena mission, the Houston-based company Intuitive Machines' second attempt to deliver Nasa science instruments near the lunar south pole touched down on March 6, 2025, in the rugged and shadowy terrain of Mons Mouton.

Go back to India: 6‑year‑old Indian‑origin girl hit in private parts in IrelandA six‑year‑old Indian‑origin girl in Waterford, Ireland, was assaulted by a group of boys who punched her, hit her private parts with a bicycle, and hurled racist abuse, telling her to "go back to India". Her mother, a nurse, who recently became an Irish citizen, said the child is now terrified to play outside and the family feels unsafe.

Pak army chief Asim Munir to visit US again, his second trip in 2 monthsThe Pakistani Army chief will attend the farewell of US Central Command Commander General Michael Kurilla, who had called Pakistan a 'phenomenal partner' in counter-terrorism.

sports.headline: Chris Woakes sides Ben Stokes on injury replacements: You have to find a wayEngland seamer Chris Woakes came out to bat on Day 5 of the final Test, despite having a dislocated shoulder. Asked if there should be injury replacements for freak accidents, Woakes did not seem to be keen about the idea.

Son ready for new chapter with LAFC after Spurs exit: Still got qualitySon Heung-min has begun a new chapter in his career, swapping Premier League prestige for an ambitious MLS stint with LAFC, aiming to bring titles and global spotlight to the American soccer landscape.

James Anderson's ordinary debut in The Hundred sparks mixed reactionsJames Anderson became the second-oldest player to feature in The Hundred at 43. He gave away 36 runs in 20 balls in his maiden outing for Manchester Originals in their defeat to Southern Brave.

India used Vaseline for ball tampering during Oval Test, says ex-Pakistan pacerENG vs IND: Former Pakistan pacer Shabbir Ahmed has alleged India of using 'Vaseline' to tamper with the ball during the Oval Test against England. India bowled out England's final four wickets on the last day with the old ball to draw the five-match series 2-2.

How Rohit Sharma intervened to stop Yashasvi Jaiswal from quitting MumbaiIndia's ODI captain Rohit Sharma urged Yashasvi Jaiswal to continue playing for Mumbai in domestic cricket and stop his move to Goa, revealed Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) President Ajinkya Naik.

ENG vs IND: Washington Sundar snubbed from Aakash Chopra's combined XIWashington Sundar could not find a place in the combined XI picked by Aakash Chopra from the recent five-match Test series between England and India. Sundar scored 284 runs in 4 matches at an average of 47.33 and also scalped seven wickets.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
